meanings.definition: To make general or broad statements without specific details.
meanings.sent1: She keeps generalizing about cats without knowing much about them.
meanings.sent2: Stop generalizing about people based on one bad experience.
meanings.sent3: He was generalizing so much about vegetables that he thought tomatoes were fruits!
meanings.sent4: Her habit of generalizing made her see all birds as messengers of good luck.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's lesson on generalizing was as clear as a sunny day.

meanings.definition: To draw a broad conclusion from specific examples.
meanings.sent1: By generalizing from the data, he concluded that all students prefer online classes.
meanings.sent2: Generalizing from just one experiment can lead to inaccurate results.
meanings.sent3: She was generalizing so much from her math homework that she thought she could solve any problem in seconds!
meanings.sent4: His talent for generalizing from history made him predict the future with uncanny accuracy.
meanings.sent5: The detective's skill in generalizing from clues was unmatched in the city.
